title: Here are the most important new changes coming to your iPhone this fall
description: On Monday, Apple debuted iOS 17 and the slew of updates it will bring to iPhones everywhere this fall.

title: Apple's Vision Pro headset will launch with Disney+ streaming
description: Disney is partnering with Apple to bring its streaming service Disney+ to the tech giant's new Vision Pro AR headset.

title: Intel drops as Apple moves to its own silicon on all computers
description: Apple's $7,000 Mac Pro computer will boast the new M2 Ultra processor, which promises performance gains over a similar system with an Intel chip.

title: Directors Guild's deal with Hollywood doesn't necessarily foreshadow end to writers strike
description: Hollywood producers struck a tentative deal with film and TV directors, but writers and actors aren't satisfied with the state of things.

title: Bitcoin drops below $26,000 after SEC sues crypto exchange Binance
description: Cryptocurrency prices dropped on Monday after the SEC charged Binance, the largest crypto exchange in the world, with violating securities laws.

title: SEC sues Binance and CEO Changpeng Zhao for U.S. securities violations
description: Binance and Zhao allegedly undermined the company's own compliance, courted U.S. investors, and traded against its customers using market-making companies.

title: RFK Jr.'s presidential bid gains boost from Silicon Valley elite
description: Block CEO Jack Dorsey endorsed Kennedy on Twitter on Sunday, while Twitter owner Elon Musk invited the contender to a live audio discussion on the platform.

title: CNN CEO Chris Licht apologizes to staff during internal Monday morning call
description: CNN CEO Chris Licht apologized to employees during an internal Monday morning call, vowing to earn staffers' trust, sources said.

title: The World Bank is betting on this company to 'green' the $1.6 trillion steel industry — take a look inside
description: Take a look inside the lab and factory of Boston Metal, the green steel startup that has attracted attention from the World Bank and ArcelorMittal.

title: Universal basic income of nearly $2,000 a month to be trialed in England for the first time
description: Plans for a universal basic income trial have just been published in the U.K., and could see people receive no-strings-attached cash for the next two years.

title: Stock markets are ignoring a 'laundry list' of risks, strategist says
description: Stock markets are ignoring a "laundry list" of potential risks in their recent bull run, according to Julian Howard, investment director at GAM Investments.

title: Italy is a bargain for vacationing Americans. Not so much for Italians
description: You'd think life would be an endless party here, but the Italians do not seem very happy these days, and with good reason.

title: China may be 'disruptive' and fueling anxiety — but talks must continue, defense chiefs say
description: Just this weekend, a Chinese warship came within 150 yards of a U.S. destroyer in the Taiwan Strait, according to the U.S. Indo-Pacific Command.

title: Air travel to be disrupted by 'very frustrating' supply chain issues, IATA's Willie Walsh says
description: "The challenges we expect to see in the short term are outside of our control," Willie Walsh told CNBC, citing a number of issues on the horizon.

title: U.S. and China trade barbs at top security summit as Taiwan Strait tensions simmer
description: China and U.S. defense chiefs trade barbs at Asia's leading defense summit after Beijing rejects meeting offer.

title: Europe is struggling with a precarious water situation ahead of another drought-riven summer
description: Reservoirs have fallen to water levels typically associated with summer heatwaves, while protests have broken out over water shortages in France and Spain.

title: Erdogan's new pick for Turkish finance minister has markets hoping for economic orthodoxy
description: Turkey's monetary policy currently places an emphasis on the pursuit of growth and export competition rather than taming inflation.

title: Is China heading for Japan-like stagnation? Economist says the worst is likely behind us
description: China's economic recovery from the pandemic is set to broaden, meaning the country isn't yet headed toward Japan-style stagnation, Macquarie's Larry Hu said.

title: IMF chief says there's no significant slowdown in lending and the Fed may need to do more
description: "There is some but not on the scale that would lead to the Fed stepping back," International Monetary Fund's managing director Kristalina Georgieva told CNBC in an interview.
